body:
Comment 8 by **elazarl**: 
Just to clarify the sate of the bug now for future readers.

From now on, ./all.bash will use whatever tools that are in your PATH. If you want, to,
eg, use the GNU tools in "C:\Program Files (x86)\GnuWin32\bin", add '/c/Program Files
(x86)/GnuWin32/bin' as the first component in your path, and ./all.bash would use the
tools there for compiling Go.

(Since I didn't understand why /bin was prepended to the path, I wrote a patch that
keeps it prepended. It probably didn't have good enough reason, and now Go installation
uses whatever is on your path.)
